did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Ford Foundation History Project

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lloyd Garrison was Director of the Office of Communications at the Ford Foundation from 1991 to 1995. In May 1995, he left the Office of Communications to research, write, and edit an authorized history, in book or video form, of the Ford Foundation from 1980-1995. The project had a deadline of May 1996 most likely to coincide with the retirement of Ford Foundation president Franklin Thomas. Garrison left the Foundation after the project ended in 1996. It appears the project never moved beyond a collection of drafts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into one series: Lloyd Garrison's Files on the Ford Foundation History Project

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2019 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2019:146.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Ford Foundation: A History Draft, Lloyd Garrison, Director, Foundation History Project, undated in Ford Foundation records, Publications (Non-Grant Related), Accession 2017:050, 1949-2016

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of material related to the Ford Foundation History Project led by Lloyd Garrison, former Director of the Ford Foundation's Office of Communications. The collection contains chapter outlines, chapter drafts, lists of other corporate/institutional history projects, research materials, project updates, meeting notes, and memos primarily from 1995-1996.
